## Checklist

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors
- [ ] I have removed any debugging code and console logs

### Testing

- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested edge cases and error conditions

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG.md
- [ ] I have added docstrings to new functions/classes

### Git Hygiene

- [ ] My commits are atomic and well-described
- [ ] I have rebased on the latest main branch
- [ ] I have resolved all merge conflicts
- [ ] My branch name is descriptive

### Academic Context

- [ ] Changes respect academic standards and best practices
- [ ] Integration with academic tools is maintained
- [ ] Citation and attribution requirements are met (if applicable)

## For Reviewers

### Review Checklist

- [ ] Code logic is sound and efficient
- [ ] Changes align with project goals
- [ ] Tests are comprehensive and passing
- [ ] Documentation is clear and complete
- [ ] No security concerns
- [ ] Performance impact is acceptable
- [ ] Breaking changes are necessary and well-documented
